description.narrative: 1. Increased access to expansion stage equity and operational value add for technology companies in Latin America (mainly focused in Brazil). The Manager's strong reputation in Brazil means its companies have gone on to receive a large portion of all venture capital (VC) allocated to the region. For example, 33 percent in 2018 and 50 percent in 2019 of all VC dollars in Brazil went to its portfolio companies. 2. Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market disrupting digital business models: The Fund is supporting investees developing tech-led innovative solutions to disrupt various real sector business models. IFC expects this will increase competitiveness across markets in Brazil that are characterized by low productivity, poor efficiency and low competition. Through provision of expansion stage capital in a difficult fundraising environment, the Fund will significantly strengthen the ability of investee companies to reach sufficient scale and catalyze markets to respond to these competitive pressures. The Manager has demonstrated market creation through innovation and demonstration. 3. Increased competitiveness of Brazil's VC market, by catalyzing further the later stage venture segment through increased VC backed M&A and exits: IFC expects that by supporting this Fund, with its strong reputation in the market, its success will help increase the competitiveness of the later stage VC ecosystem in Latin America.

The proposed investment is an equity investment of up to US$15 million in Monashees Expansion Fund, (MEF or the Fund), a Delaware domiciled fund focused on investing in later stage technology companies in Latin America. The? Fund will be managed by Monashees Expansion Partners, L.P., Delaware (Monashees, Manager). The IFC is also requesting a US$15 million delegated authority co-investment envelope.
